name: Vacuum
description: Runtime Compressor for DOS32 executables.

name: WinLite
description: Compresses Windows executables (such as Pklite, Diet or Wwpack) for executables programs under DOS.

name: WWPack
description: Squeezes EXE files, compresses relocation tables, optimizes headers, protects EXE files from hacking.

name: XE
description: PE32 image file packer and rebuilder.

name: XorCopy
description: COM file XOR-based encrypter.

name: XORER
description: COM file XOR-based encrypter.

name: XPA
description: DOS executable packer.

name: XPack
description: EXE/COM/SYS executable file compressor.

name: Android Unpacker
description: Android Unpacker presented at Defcon 22: Android Hacker Protection Level 0.

name: Angr
description: Platform-agnostic binary analysis framework.

name: APKiD
description: Android application Identifier for packers, protectors, obfuscators and oddities - PEiD for Android.

name: aPLib
description: Compression library based on the algorithm used in aPACK.

name: AppSpear
description: Universal and automated unpacking system suitable for both Dalvik and ART.

name: Assiste (Packer)
description: Assiste.com's example list of packers.

name: AVClass
description: Python tools to tag / label malware samples.

name: Bintropy
description: Prototype analysis tool that estimates the likelihood that a binary file contains compressed or encrypted bytes.

name: BinUnpack
description: Unpacking approach free from tedious memory access monitoring, therefore introducing very small runtime overhead.

name: Binutils
description: The GNU Binutils are a collection of binary tools for Linux (it namely includes Readelf).

name: BitBlaze
description: Analysis platform that features a novel fusion of static and dynamic analysis techniques, mixed concrete and symbolic execution, and whole-system emulation and binary instrumentation, all to facilitate state-of-the art research on real security problems.

name: Capa
description: Open-source tool to identify capabilities in PE, ELF or .NET executable files.

name: Capstone
description: Lightweight multi-platform, multi-architecture disassembly framework.

name: CFF Explorer
description: PE32/64 and .NET editor, part of the Explorer Suite.

name: ChkEXE
description: Identifies almost any EXE/COM packer, crypter or protector.

name: Clamscan Unpacker
description: Unpacker derived from ClamAV.

name: COM2EXE
description: Free tool for converting COM files to EXE format.

name: de4dot
description: .NET deobfuscator and unpacker.

name: de4js
description: JavaScript Deobfuscator and Unpacker.

name: Defacto2 Analyzers Archive
description: Collection of 60 binary files analysers for MS-DOS and Windows32 from the 1990s and the 2000s.

name: Defacto2 Packers Archive
description: Collection of 460 binary and data file packers for MS-DOS and Windows32 from the 1990s and 2000s.

name: Defacto2 Unpackers Archive
description: Collection of 152 binary files unpackers for MS-DOS and Windows 32 from the 1990s and 2000s.

name: DIE
description: Detect It Easy ; Program for determining types of files.

name: DSFF
description: DataSet File Format for exchanging datasets and converting to ARFF (for use with Weka), CSV or Packing-Box's dataset structure.

name: DynamoRIO
description: Runtime code manipulation system that supports code transformations on any part of a program, while it executes.

name: Emulator
description: Symantec Endpoint Protector (from v14) capability to create a virtual machine on the fly to identify, detonate, and eliminate malware hiding inside custom malware packers.

name: EtherUnpack
description: Precision universal automated unpacker (successor of PolyUnpack).

name: Eureka
description: Binary static analysis preparation framework implementing a novel binary unpacking strategy based on statistical bigram analysis and coarse-grained execution tracing.

name: EXEInfo-PE
description: Fast detector for executable PE files.

name: ExeScan
description: Executable file analyzer which detects the most famous  EXE/COM Protectors, Packers, Converters and compilers.

name: EXETools
description: Forum for reverse engineering and executale packing related topics.

name: FUU
description: Fast Universal Unpacker.

name: GetTyp
description: File format detection program for DOS based on special strings and byte code.

name: GUnpacker
description: Shell tool that performs OEP positioning and dumps decrypted code.

name: IDR
description: Interactive Delphi Reconstructor.

name: ImpREC
description: This can be used to repair the import table for packed programs.

name: Justin
description: Just-In-Time AV scanning ; generic unpacking solution.

name: Language 2000
description: Ultimate compiler detection utility.

name: LIEF
description: Library to Instrument Executable Formats ; Python package for parsing PE, ELF, Mach-O and DEX formats, modifying and rebuilding executables.

name: LordPE
description: PE header viewer, editor and rebuilder.

name: Malheur
description: Tool for the automatic analysis of malware behavior (recorded from malicious software in a sandbox environment).

name: MalUnpack
description: Dynamic unpacker based on PE-sieve.

name: Manalyze
description: Robust parser for PE files with a flexible plugin architecture which allows users to statically analyze files in-depth.

name: MRC
description: (Mandiant Red Curtain) Free software for Incident Responders that assists with the analysis of malware ; it examines executable files (e.g., .exe, .dll, and so on) to determine how suspicious they are based on a set of criteria.

name: .NET Deobfuscator
description: List of .NET Deobfuscators and Unpackers.

name: Oedipus
description: A Python framework that uses machine learning algorithms to implement the metadata recovery attack against obfuscated programs.

name: OEPdet
description: Automated original-entry-point detector.

name: OllyDbg Scripts
description: Collection of OllyDbg scripts for unpacking many different packers.

name: OmniUnpack
description: New technique for fast, generic, and safe unpacking of malware by monitoring the execution in real-time and detecting the removed layers of packing.

name: PackerAttacker
description: Tool that uses memory and code hooks to detect packers.

name: PackerBreaker
description: Tool for helping unpack, decompress and decrypt most of the programs packed, compressed or encrypted using advanced emulation technology.

name: PackerGrind
description: Adaptive unpacking tool for tracking packing bahaviors and unpacking Android packed apps.

name: PackerID
description: Fork of packerid.py using PEid signatures and featuring additional output types, formats, digital signature extraction, and disassembly support.

name: PackID
description: Packer identification multiplatform tool/library using the same database syntax as PEiD.

name: Packing-Box
description: Docker image gathering many packing-related tools and for making datasets of packed executables for use with machine learning.

name: PANDA
description: Platform for Architecture-Neutral Dynamic Analysis.

name: Pandora's Bochs
description: Extension to the Bochs PC eumlator to enable it to monitor execution of the unpacking stubs for extracting the original code.

name: PCjs
description: PCjs uses JavaScript to recreate the IBM PC experience, using original ROMs, CPUs running at their original speeds, and early IBM video cards and monitors.

name: PE Compression Test
description: List of packers tested on a few sample executables for comparing compressed sizes.

name: PE Detective
description: This GUI tool can scan single PE files or entire directories (also recursevely) and generate complete reports.

name: PE-bear
description: Freeware reversing tool for PE files aimed to deliver fast and flexible “first view” for malware analysts, stable and capable to handle malformed PE files.

name: PEdump
description: Dump windows PE files using Ruby.

name: Pefeats
description: Utility for extracting 119 features from a PE file for use with machine learning algorithms.

name: Pefile
description: Multi-platform Python module to parse and work with Portable Executable files.

name: PEFrame
description: Tool for performing static analysis on PE malware and generic suspicious files.

name: PEiD
description: Packed Executable iDentifier.

name: PEiD (CLI)
description: Python implementation of PEiD featuring an additional tool for making new signatures.

name: PEiD (yara)
description: Yet another implementation of PEiD with yara.

name: PeLib
description: PE file manipulation library.

name: PEPack
description: PE file packer detection tool, part of the Unix package "pev".

name: PEscan
description: CLI tool to scan PE files to identify how they were constructed.

name: PETools
description: Old-school reverse engineering tool (with a long history since 2002) for manipulating PE files.

name: PEview
description: Provides a quick and easy way to view the structure and content of 32-bit Portable Executable (PE) and Component Object File Format (COFF) files.

name: PExplorer
description: Most feature-packed program for inspecting the inner workings of your own software, and more importantly, third party Windows applications and libraries for which you do not have source code.

name: Pin
description: Dynamic binary instrumentation framework for the IA-32, x86-64 and MIC instruction-set architectures that enables the creation of dynamic program analysis tools.

name: PINdemonium
description: Unpacker for PE files exploiting the capabilities of PIN.

name: PolyUnpack
description: Implemention attempt of the general approach for extracting the original hidden code of PE files without any heuristic assumptions.

name: PortEx
description: Java library for static malware analysis of PE files with a focus on PE malformation robustness and anomaly detection.

name: PROTECTiON iD
description: PE file signature-based scanner.

name: ProTools
description: Programmer's Tools, a web site dedicated for all kinds of tools and utilities for the true WinBloze programmer, including packers, crypters, etc.

name: PyPackerDetect
description: Small python script/library to detect whether an executable is packed.

name: PyPackerDetect (refactored)
description: A complete refactoring of the original project to a Python package with a console script to detect whether an executable is packed.

name: PyPeid
description: Yet another implementation of PEiD with yara-python.

name: Quick Unpack
description: Generic unpacker that facilitates the unpacking process.

name: RDG Packer Detector
description: Packer detection tool.

name: Reko
description: Free decompiler for machine code binaries.

name: REMINDer
description: Packing detection tool based on the entropy value of the entry point section and the WRITE attribute.

name: REMnux
description: Linux toolkit for reverse-engineering and analyzing malicious software.

name: Renovo
description: Detection tool built on top of TEMU (dynamic analysis component of BitBlaze) based on the execution of newly-generated code and monitoring memory writes after the program starts.

name: ResourceHacker
description: Resource editor for 32bit and 64bit Windows applications.

name: RetDec
description: Retargetable machine-code decompiler based on LLVM.

name: RTD
description: Rose Patch - TinyProt/Rosetiny Unpacker.

name: RUPP
description: ROSE SWE UnPaCKER PaCKaGE (for DOS executables only).

name: ShowStopper
description: Tool to help malware researchers explore and test anti-debug techniques or verify debugger plugins or other solutions that clash with standard anti-debug methods.

name: StudPE
description: PE viewer and editor (32/64 bit).

name: SymPack
description: Safe, portable, largely eﬀective but not generic library for packing detection and unpacking ; part of the Norton Antivirus solution.

name: Titanium Platform
description: Machine learning hybrid cloud platform that harvests thousands of file types at scale, speeds threat detection through machine learning binary analysis, and continuously monitors an index of over 10B files for future threats.

name: TrID
description: Utility for identifying file types from their binary signatures.

name: Triton
description: Dynamic binary analysis library.

name: Tuts 4 You
description: Non-commercial, independent community dedicated to the sharing of knowledge and information on reverse code engineering.

name: Unipacker
description: Automatic and platform-independent unpacker for Windows binaries based on emulation.

name: UnpacMe
description: Automated malware unpacking service.

name: Unpckarc
description: Packed executables detection tool relying on several heuristics.

name: UU
description: Universal Unpacker.

name: Uundo
description: Universal Undo - Universal Unpacker.

name: Uunp (IDA Pro plugin)
description: IDA Pro debugger plug-in module automating the analysis and unpacking of packed binaries.

name: UUP
description: Universal exe-file UnPacker.

name: VirusTotal
description: File analysis Web service for detecting malware.

name: VMUnpacker
description: Unpacker based on the technology of virtual machine.

name: Winbindex
description: An index of Windows binaries, including download links for executables such as EXE, DLL and SYS files.
